Quote: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: The Seven Social Sins are: Wealth without work. Pleasure without conscience. Knowledge without character. Commerce without morality. Science without humanity. Worship without sacrifice. Politics without principle.From a sermon given by Frederick Lewis Donaldson in Westminster Abbey, London, on March 20, 1925.
Author: Frederick Lewis Donaldson

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Hold fast to dreams,For if dreams dieLife is a broken-winged bird,That cannot fly.
Author: Langston Hughes

Quote: I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn’t know.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Any fool can know. The point is to understand.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire.
Author: L. Frank Baum,  The Lost Princess of Oz

Quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
Author: John Locke

Quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
Author: Dan Brown,  The Lost Symbol

Quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.
Author: Eoin Colfer,  Artemis Fowl

Quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.
Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

Quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think
Author: Socrates

Quote: Write what you know. That should leave you with a lot of free time.
Author: Howard Nemerov

Quote: It is the absence of facts that frightens people: the gap you open, into which they pour their fears, fantasies, desires.
Author: Hilary Mantel,  Wolf Hall

Quote: All knowledge hurts.
Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

Quote: Last night I lost the world, and gained the universe.
Author: C. JoyBell C.

Quote: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

Quote: I mean, you could claim that anything's real if the only basis for believing in it is that nobody's proved it doesn't exist!
Author: J.K. Rowling

Quote: Doctor Who: You want weapons? We're in a library. Books are the best weapon in the world. This room's the greatest arsenal we could have. Arm yourself!(from Tooth and Claw in Season 2)
Author: Russell T. Davies

Quote: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
Author: Anaïs Nin

Quote: If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to.
Author: Margaret Atwood,  The Blind Assassin

Quote: I have been and still am a seeker, but I have ceased to question stars and books; I have begun to listen to the teaching my blood whispers to me.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

Quote: The surest way of concealing from others the boundaries of one's own knowledge is not to overstep them.
Author: Giacomo Leopardi

Quote: Wisdom cannot be imparted. Wisdom that a wise man attempts to impart always sounds like foolishness to someone else ... Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.
Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha

Quote: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
Author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

Quote: Knowledge is power. Power to do evil...or power to do good. Power itself is not evil. So knowledge itself is not evil.
Author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

Quote: People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: Inventory:"Four be the things I am wiser to know:Idleness, sorrow, a friend, and a foe.Four be the things I'd been better without:Love, curiosity, freckles, and doubt.Three be the things I shall never attain:Envy, content, and sufficient champagne.Three be the things I shall have till I die:Laughter and hope and a sock in the eye.
Author: Dorothy Parker,  The Complete Poems of Dorothy Parker

Quote: Knowledge, like air, is vital to life. Like air, no one should be denied it.
Author: Alan Moore,  V for Vendetta

Quote: It takes a very long time to become young.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: A woman, especially if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.
Author: Ronald E. Osborn

Quote: I do not pretend to be able to prove that there is no God. I equally cannot prove that Satan is a fiction. The Christian god may exist; so may the gods of Olympus, or of ancient Egypt, or of Babylon. But no one of these hypotheses is more probable than any other: they lie outside the region of even probable knowledge, and therefore there is no reason to consider any of them.
Author: Bertrand Russell,  Why I Am Not a Christian and Other Essays on Religion and Related Subjects

Quote: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.
Author: Isaac Asimov

Quote: Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Cat's Cradle

Quote: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social enviroment. Most people are incapable of forming such opinions."(Essay to Leo Baeck, 1953)
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: A little knowledge is a dangerous thing. So is a lot.
Author: Alexander Pope

Quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

Quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
Author: Will Durant,  The Story of Philosophy

Quote: Remember it all, every insult, every tear. Tattoo it on the inside of your mind. In life, knowledge of poisons is essential. I've told you, nobody becomes an artist unless they have to.
Author: Janet Fitch

Quote: It is sometimes easier to be happy if you don't know everything.
Author: Alexander McCall Smith,  Morality for Beautiful Girls

Quote: An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
Author: Benjamin Franklin,  The Way to Wealth: Ben Franklin on Money and Success

Quote: It was better to know the worst than to wonder.
Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind

Quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
Author: Robertson Davies,  Tempest-Tost

Quote: The eye through which I see God is the same eye through which God sees me; my eye and God's eye are one eye, one seeing, one knowing, one love.
Author: Meister Eckhart,  Sermons of Meister Eckhart

Quote: Don't fuck with an English major. They keep lots of useless crap trapped in their heads. Once in a while they let some of it out and it bites you square on the ass.
Author: P.C. Cast,  Divine By Mistake

Quote: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: Whatever in creation exists without my knowledge exists without my consent.
Author: Cormac McCarthy,  Blood Meridian, or the Evening Redness in the West

Quote: What is now proved was once only imagined.
Author: William Blake

Quote: I definitely learned a lesson this time. I know that I can be broken. I am not as tough as I thought. I see it now. At this point, it's the only thing good that came out of all of this. I know myself better now and know what I have to do.
Author: Henry Rollins,  The Portable Henry Rollins

Quote: You can't know, you can only believe - or not.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: The hardest thing of all is to find a black cat in a dark room, especially if there is no cat.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
Author: Charles Darwin,  The Descent of Man

Quote: The knowledge of all things is possible
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: To know that you do not know is the best.To think you know when you do not is a disease.Recognizing this disease as a disease is to be free of it.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds

Quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quote: I am the coffee, and God is The Barista. Through me, he may awaken your soul. But the coffee knows not what flows through the mind of The Barista.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Quote: Information is not knowledge.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: ... there is no shame in not knowing. The problem arises when irrational thought and attendant behavior fill the vacuum left by ignorance.
Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson,  The Sky Is Not the Limit: Adventures of an Urban Astrophysicist

Quote: Remember my friend, that knowledge is stronger than memory, and we should not trust the weaker
Author: Bram Stoker,  DRACULA

Quote: No, our science is no illusion. But an illusion it would be to suppose that what science cannot give us we can get elsewhere.
Author: Sigmund Freud,  The Future of an Illusion

Quote: Doubt … is an illness that comes from knowledge and leads to madness.
Author: Gustave Flaubert,  Memoirs of a Madman

Quote: To learn which questions are unanswerable, and not to answer them: this skill is most needful in times of stress and darkness.
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Left Hand of Darkness

Quote: No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.The teacher who walks in the shadow of the temple, among his followers, gives not of his wisdom but rather of his faith and his lovingness.If he is indeed wise he does not bid you enter the house of his wisdom, but rather leads you to the threshold of your own mind.
Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet

Quote: Love is something to be treated with awe. Or should it be aww? People don’t know my capacity for love. If you tried to bottle it up, I’m sure it would take at least three thermoses to contain it. And if it did get contained, would you drink my love black, or would you add cream and sugar?
Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..

Quote: Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: nothing that is worth knowing can be taught
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the truth.[Verse 223]
Author: Gautama Buddha,  The Dhammapada

Quote: What transforms this world is — knowledge. Do you see what I mean? Nothing else can change anything in this world. Knowledge alone is capable of transforming the world, while at the same time leaving it exactly as it is. When you look at the world with knowledge, you realize that things are unchangeable and at the same time are constantly being transformed.
Author: Yukio Mishima,  The Temple of the Golden Pavilion

Quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
Author: William Blake

Quote: The power of human thought grows exponentially with the number of minds that share that thought.
Author: Dan Brown,  The Lost Symbol

Quote: When you reach the end of what you should know, you will be at the beginning of what you should sense.
Author: Kahlil Gibran,  Sand and Foam

Quote: Don't be in a hurry to condemn because he doesn't do what you do or think as you think or as fast. There was a time when you didn't know what you know today.
Author: Malcolm X

Quote: The advancement and diffusion of knowledge is the only guardian of true liberty.
Author: James Madison

Quote: Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write .
Author: John Adams,  The Works Of John Adams, Second President Of The United States

Quote: He was twenty. I remembered twenty. I'd known everything at twenty. It took me another year to realize I knew nothing. I was still hoping to learn something before I hit thirty, but I wasn't holding my breath.
Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Circus of the Damned

Quote: Properly, we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.
Author: Ezra Pound

Quote: Wisdom is knowing when you are being patient, and when you are wasting time by waiting.
Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
